private_information: I am responsible for the left peg.
The left peg initially holds disks from top to bottom: A, B, C, D, E where A is smallest and E is largest.
left_keeper.goal: Report an accurate, machine-readable description of the left peg contents and any local constraints about disk ordering.

private_information: I am responsible for the middle peg.
The middle peg is initially empty.
middle_keeper.goal: Report an accurate, machine-readable description of the middle peg contents and any local constraints about disk ordering.

private_information: I am responsible for the right peg.
The right peg is initially empty.
right_keeper.goal: Report an accurate, machine-readable description of the right peg contents and any local constraints about disk ordering.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate the peg reports and produce a complete PDDL domain and PDDL problem file targeting the FastDownwards solver that moves the full stack from the left peg to the right peg while respecting Hanoi rules.

public_information: There are three pegs named left, middle, and right.
There are five disks labelled A (smallest), B, C, D, E (largest).
Only one disk can be moved at a time.
A larger disk may never be placed on top of a smaller disk.
Initial configuration: left peg has top-to-bottom A, B, C, D, E; middle and right pegs are empty.
Goal configuration: right peg has top-to-bottom A, B, C, D, E; left and middle pegs are empty.

describe.system_prompt: You are a peg reporter responsible for the left peg. Provide a concise machine-readable description of the objects on your peg and their top-to-bottom order and mention any local constraints you observe. Do not produce PDDL.
describe.prompt: Your name is left_keeper. Use the public information {environment->public_information} and your private information {agents->left_keeper->private_information} to produce a clear machine-readable description of the left peg state that the orchestrator can consume. Your goal is {agents->left_keeper->goal}.

describe.system_prompt: You are a peg reporter responsible for the middle peg. Provide a concise machine-readable description of the objects on your peg and their top-to-bottom order and mention any local constraints you observe. Do not produce PDDL.
describe.prompt: Your name is middle_keeper. Use the public information {environment->public_information} and your private information {agents->middle_keeper->private_information} to produce a clear machine-readable description of the middle peg state that the orchestrator can consume. Your goal is {agents->middle_keeper->goal}.

describe.system_prompt: You are a peg reporter responsible for the right peg. Provide a concise machine-readable description of the objects on your peg and their top-to-bottom order and mention any local constraints you observe. Do not produce PDDL.
describe.prompt: Your name is right_keeper. Use the public information {environment->public_information} and your private information {agents->right_keeper->private_information} to produce a clear machine-readable description of the right peg state that the orchestrator can consume. Your goal is {agents->right_keeper->goal}.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in PDDL and multi-agent planning integration. Using the peg state reports as inputs, produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file that encode the Tower of Hanoi instance and are suitable for the FastDownwards planner. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Ensure the domain models moves that transfer a single top disk between pegs and enforces the rule that no larger disk may be placed on a smaller disk. The problem should instantiate the five disks and three pegs and set the initial and goal configurations as provided.
pddl.prompt: Your name is orchestrator. You will receive peg reports {state_left}, {state_middle}, and {state_right} produced by the peg keeper agents. Use the public information {environment->public_information} and integrate the reports into a single PDDL domain and problem that move the full stack from left to right while respecting all Tower of Hanoi constraints. Target the FastDownwards solver and provide both domain and problem. Enclose the domain in <domain></domain> and the problem in <problem></problem>. Your output will be consumed as {workflow->orchestrator->pddl->output}.
